content:
A national park road trip out west sounds like an amazing adventure! With 7-10 days, you have a good amount of time to explore some of the most beautiful parks and scenic routes in the country. Here are a few options to consider:

**Option 1: Grand Teton and Yellowstone Loop**

* Start from your hometown and head west on I-90 to Jackson, Wyoming (approx. 18 hours)
* Visit Grand Teton National Park and explore the scenic roads, hiking trails, and lakes
* Continue north to Yellowstone National Park, America's first national park, and explore its geysers, hot springs, and wildlife (approx. 1 hour)
* Take the scenic Beartooth Highway (US-212) to Montana and visit the Beartooth Mountains (approx. 4 hours)
* Return to Yellowstone and explore the west side of the park, including Old Faithful and the Grand Prismatic Spring
* Head back east on I-90 to your hometown (approx. 18 hours)

**Option 2: Utah's Mighty Five National Parks**

* Start from your hometown and head west on I-70 to Moab, Utah (approx. 16 hours)
* Visit Arches National Park and explore the scenic drives, hiking trails, and over 2,000 natural arches
* Continue to Canyonlands National Park and explore the Island in the Sky and The Needles districts (approx. 30 minutes)
* Drive to Capitol Reef National Park and explore the scenic drives, hiking trails, and historic sites (approx. 2.5 hours)
* Visit Bryce Canyon National Park and explore the scenic drives, hiking trails, and unique hoodoos (approx. 2.5 hours)
* End at Zion National Park and explore the scenic drives, hiking trails, and canyons (approx. 1.5 hours)
* Return to your hometown via I-70 (approx. 16 hours)

**Option 3: California's Sierra Nevada and Yosemite**

* Start from your hometown and head west on I-80 to Sacramento, California (approx. 20 hours)
* Visit Yosemite National Park and explore the scenic drives, hiking trails, and iconic landmarks like Half Dome and El Capitan
* Drive to Sequoia National Park and explore the scenic drives, hiking trails, and giant sequoia groves (approx. 4 hours)
* Visit Kings Canyon National Park and explore the scenic drives, hiking trails, and deepest canyon in North America (approx. 1 hour)
* Return to your hometown via I-80 (approx. 20 hours)

All of these options offer stunning scenery, unique national parks, and exciting stops along the way. You can adjust the itinerary to fit your interests, time constraints, and preferences.

Which option resonates with you, or would you like me to suggest more routes or modifications to these options?
